keyMoments.title: Nuru's Debut and Challenge to Zoro
keyMoments.description: Nuru appears at Gyoncorde Plaza, declaring his ambition to become an officer and the strongest swordsman of Fish-Man Island, challenging Roronoa Zoro.
keyMoments.significance: Anime-original character debut. Does not appear in manga.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Zoro
keyMoments.description: Nuru attempts to blind Zoro with his lightbulb but is easily defeated when Zoro cuts the lightbulb off his head and sends him flying.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the gap between Nuru's ambition and actual strength. Shows Zoro's superior abilities.

keyMoments.title: Killed by Hyouzou
keyMoments.description: In his drunken, steroid-fueled rampage, the transformed Hyouzou indiscriminately cuts down Nuru, killing him.
keyMoments.significance: Character death. Shows Hyouzou's loss of control and willingness to attack allies.

abilities.description: As an angler fish-man, Nuru has a lightbulb attached to his forehead that can emit bright light to blind opponents.

reveals.information: Wants to become the strongest swordsman of Fish-Man Island and an officer

keyMoments.title: Gomu Gomu no Snake Shot
keyMoments.description: Luffy uses Gomu Gomu no Snake Shot for the first time to attack Hody Jones and force him to release Shirahoshi, breaking one of Hody's ribs despite being underwater.
keyMoments.significance: First use of this post-timeskip technique. Demonstrates Luffy's ability to fight effectively underwater after his training.
keyMoments.quote: I spent the last two years training to do just that!

abilities.description: Luffy throws his arms in a meandering snake-like fashion before gripping the opponent's body tightly like a snake biting its prey.

reveals.information: Can fight effectively underwater despite Devil Fruit weakness through training

keyMoments.title: Defeats Nuru
keyMoments.description: Zoro easily defeats the anime-original character Nuru by cutting the lightbulb off his forehead and dismissing him as weak.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Zoro's post-timeskip strength against a minor opponent.

keyMoments.title: Volunteers to Fight Hyouzou
keyMoments.description: Zoro blocks Hyouzou's attack on Robin, cutting through Hyouzou's sword, and declares he will take on Hyouzou as warmup for the New World.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up the Zoro vs Hyouzou matchup. Demonstrates Zoro's confidence and protective nature.
keyMoments.quote: I'll be taking on Hyouzou. He'll be a good warmup for the New World.

name.japanese: ホーディ・ジョーンズ

keyMoments.title: Defeats Vander Decken IX
keyMoments.description: Hody decisively defeats Vander Decken IX, pulling his trident out of Decken's body and claiming it as his weapon.
keyMoments.significance: Eliminates his former ally and establishes Hody as the sole primary antagonist.

keyMoments.title: Pursues Shirahoshi
keyMoments.description: Hody uses his overwhelming underwater speed to cut through Ryuboshi and Manboshi, reaching Shirahoshi and grabbing her by the hair.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Hody's superior underwater abilities and poses immediate threat to Shirahoshi.

reveals.information: Possesses overwhelming speed and power underwater, far exceeding typical fish-men

keyMoments.title: Energy Steroid Transformation
keyMoments.description: Hyouzou consumes excessive Energy Steroids while drunk, causing his hair to turn white and slick back. He enters an uncontrollable rampage.
keyMoments.significance: Major transformation showing dangerous side effects of Energy Steroid overdose.

keyMoments.title: Kills Nuru
keyMoments.description: In his transformed state, Hyouzou indiscriminately attacks and kills Nuru, demonstrating his complete loss of control.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Hyouzou will attack even his own allies in this state.

keyMoments.title: Chidoriashi Hash
keyMoments.description: Hyouzou uses his Chidoriashi Hash technique while on his rampage, cutting down several people with his Eight Sword Style.

abilities.description: A multi-sword attack using Hyouzou's Eight Sword Style to cut down multiple opponents.

reveals.information: Energy Steroid overdose causes physical transformation and loss of control

keyMoments.title: Fish-Man Karate: 7000 Brick Roundhouse Kick
keyMoments.description: Jinbe blocks Wadatsumi's massive fist using his Fish-Man Karate technique, stopping the attack with his foot and hurting Wadatsumi's hand despite the size difference.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Jinbe's mastery of Fish-Man Karate against enormous opponents.

abilities.description: A powerful roundhouse kick technique strong enough to block attacks from opponents many times larger than the user.

keyMoments.title: Receives Energy Steroid
keyMoments.description: Zeo deceives Wadatsumi and gives him an Energy Steroid, which reinvigorates him and causes him to begin a rampage.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the manipulative tactics of the New Fish-Man Pirates and sets up the battle.

keyMoments.title: Defeats Surume
keyMoments.description: Energized by the Energy Steroid, Wadatsumi overpowers and defeats Surume, demonstrating his increased strength.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the immediate power boost from Energy Steroids.
